title: 111_hr3282
content: The program provides readjustment and mental health care services to veterans of Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs shall establish a program to provide peer outreach, support, counseling, and mental health services to veterans of Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom, as well as their immediate family members for readjustment to civilian life and recovery from injuries or illnesses incurred during deployment. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will contract with community mental health centers and qualified entities to provide services for veterans of Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom, focusing on peer outreach, counseling, and mental health support for readjustment to civilian life and recovery from deployment-related injuries or illnesses. The contracted centers and entities must employ trained veterans, utilize telehealth services, and participate in a training program. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will contract with community mental health centers and qualified entities to provide services for veterans of Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom. The contracted centers and entities must comply with applicable protocols, submit annual reports, and provide mental health services for veterans. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will contract with mental health centers to provide clinical summary information and training for veterans to offer peer-outreach and peer-support services. Additionally, clinicians at these centers will undergo training to provide services tailored to the unique experiences of veterans who served in Operation Iraqi Freedom. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will implement a program for veterans who served in Operation Iraqi Freedom or Operation Enduring Freedom, using best practices and technologies. Reports on the implementation plan and status will be submitted to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs. The report on the implementation of the program for veterans includes information on the number of veterans receiving services, evaluation of service provision, a list of mental health organizations providing services, and assessment of training provided.
